attributes.action: call for the amendment of the Resolution of the House of 19th July 1995 relating to ‘The Code Of Conduct For Members Of Parliament’ such that any MP stepping down from the Commons due to dishonourable actions, either voluntarily or when called upon to do so by their own party, would do so immediately and not be entitled to receive the Resettlement Grant and any other benefits normally paid to retiring MP’s.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is wrong that MPs shamed into stepping down (for example after abusing the parliamentary expenses system) should cost taxpayers substantial sums in salaries, pensions and allowances by staying in the Commons until a General Election.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
